PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. \u2018I loved Shahid in Udta Punjab and.description: His debut film Arjun Reddy turned out to be a game changer in Tollywood. Two years on, the doctor-turned-director is all set to retell the same story again in Hindi. When asked what it felt like to remake his own film in another language, Sandeep Reddy Vanga says, “Actually, I don’t know why I made Arjun Reddy in Telugu. Probably because it is my mother tongue. But after the kind of response it got, I realised that the story I penned is universal and deserves to be told to a wider audience.” In a tête-à-tête with Hyderabad Times, the filmmaker gives a low down on what convinced him that Shahid was best suited to play Vijay Deverakonda’s role, why he thinks Telanganites are a lot like Punjabis and how he doesn’t get perturbed by the criticism that his protagonist is an epitome of toxic masculinity. Excerpts… From the trailers it seems like there is a slight shift in the tone of Kabir Singh when compared to Arjun Reddy. Was it intentional? No. There might be a little shift in tone because first of all, the language is different. The tonality of a Punjabi in Delhi is nowhere similar to that of a Telugu boy in Mangalore. Plus, life in medical colleges of North India is completely different from what it is like here down South. So, Kabir Singh will be a little different from Arjun Reddy even though the story and screenplay remain the same. However, there are a few scenes that I filmed for the Telugu version but didn’t use; they will feature in the Hindi version. Also, I did chop down the length by 12 mins, it’s 2-hours-50-minutes-long now. They say Telugus are the Punjabis of the South. It seems like you think so too, considering you chose to recast the Telangana boy Arjun Reddy into a Punjabi munda, Kabir Singh? (Laughs) A lot of people disagree with me, but I personally feel that there are a lot of similarities between us Telanganaites and Punjabis. We are as loud they are, we love to party the way they do, drinking, eating and dancing away to glory. I could easily imagine Kabir Singh doing the things Arjun Reddy did. I was only worried about the dialogues, because I wrote them in Telugu and they were very colloquial. Here I had to depend on a writer but thankfully, it was a smooth sail. What was the thought process behind casting Shahid, a 30-something-father-of-two, as a medical student? I don’t know... maybe because of his previous work and because he’s a good actor. I loved Shahid in Udta Punjab and Kaminey, so it was a no-brainer to cast him. Plus, if we keep aside the fact that he’s been in the industry for 15 long years, to any outsider looking in, he wouldn’t look old. Shahid transformed himself to look the part; he even lost weight on his face. Also, Kiara Advani looks nothing like Shalini Pandey...Kiara fits the bill perfectly to play Preeti; she has the innocence and timidness we needed. She looks every bit like the junior Kabir would fall in love with the second he saw her. How different was it working in Bollywood?I had a comfortable time there. Working with technicians and actors there is no different from here. The only annoying thing about Bombay is that no one wants to work before 11.30 in the morning. The first day I went to office at 9, even the jhaadu wali wasn’t there yet. Everyone there is laidback, be it the technicians who do colour correction and editing or casting agents. When I would ask people to meet me early, they would look at me like I’m crazy. Harshavardhan Rameshwar composed the BGM of Kabir Singh too. But why five different music directors for nine songs?I have never worked like this and if I’m being honest, I was really sceptical of having a different composer for every song because the album as a whole needs to look balanced at the end of the day. But the balance is so right, it has turned into the best album of the year is what I’ve been told. It was a little tiring to explain the film five different times to different people, but I realised every composer gave his best to the song he was composing. Arjun Reddy/Kabir Singh has been criticised as being chauvinistic… A hyper macho, self destructive hero who just has to have his way with everyone, even the girl he loves, isn’t exactly the perfect role model for young men out there...You see, when you make art you always manage to upset someone or the other; it’s been so for centuries now. To be honest, I don’t even know why people call my film chauvinistic, but I don’t feel bad about it nor do I feel the need to explain. when I took Arjun Reddy to the Censor Board, a lady there had asked me why my character goes to different classrooms and says the girl is his. I asked her, ‘how is it different from a marriage? When a man ties the knot, he’s essentially saying the same thing, in front of many people. My film doesn’t pander to the male gaze with titillating cleavage and navel shots; no frame of mine is gratuitous. I honestly thought the Hindi audience and censor board would be a little more liberal, but it’s no different. The lesson I’ve learnt from this is that a director should always give himself time to deal with the censor board and the revising committee. Will you continue making Telugu films?Of course. In fact, my next film will be in Telugu, even though I don’t know yet what it’ll be about. I’m penning a crime drama too. But, to be honest, I don’t believe in the concept of being just a ‘Hindi filmmaker’ or ‘Telugu filmmaker’. There’s no longer a language barrier. A pan-Indian film is easy to attempt. Telangana high court restrains forest of.description: HYDERABAD: Justice Sanjay Kumar of the Telangana high court on Thursday directed the forest officials of Mahabubabad district not to dispossess the tribal people living in Kodiselagattu and Komatlagudem forest villages in Gangaram mandal of the district. You have to follow due process of law before initiating any action here, he said while hearing two separate petitions filed by Kinnera Buchakka and 24 others from Komatlagudem village and P Kannaiah and 23 others from Kodiselagattu village charging the officials with unlawfully evicting them from their dwellings and fields. Petitioners’ counsel S Raj Kumar told the court that the Scheduled Tribes and Other Traditional Forest Dwellers (Recognition of Forest Rights) Act, 2006, accords rights to the traditional forest dwellers and in fact makes it obligatory for the officials to accord recognition to the tribals through granting of pattas etc. The petitioners belong to Koya tribe living in the forests for a very long time. They eke out their livelihood by collecting minor forest produces, through podu cultivation and by taking up manual labour works in the nearby villages, the counsel said. The officials have to hold Gram Sabhas and identify the people who have been living in the forest areas for a long time. Rights have to be conferred on them. They can evict only those who were not part of these villages, the counsel said. Forest dwellers have a right to protect, regenerate or conserve or manage any community forest resource, he said. Gram Sabha alone can determine the nature of individual and community rights under the Act, he said. State can constitute sub-division level committee to examine the resolutions of Gram Sabha, he said. The decisions taken by sub division committee can be challenged before a district level committee under the Act, he added. There should be a state level monitoring committee above these two committees. Without following any of this process, the forest officials have been forcibly evicting the tribals from their villages, Raj Kumar said. State counsel Narender Reddy, however, said that the officials will follow due process of law. The judge issued notices to authorities of home, panchayat raj and forest departments and sought counters from them by July 17. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

CM to inaugurate Kaleshwaram project tod.description: HYDERABAD: Kaleshwaram--billed as the world's largest multi-stage lift irrigation project-- across the Goadavari river in Telangana will be inaugurated on Friday. Chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao will formally inaugurate the Kaleshwaram Lift Irrigation Project (KLIP) in the presence of his Maharashtra and Andhra Pradesh counterparts and governor E S L Narasimhan. Touted as the 'lifeline' of Telangana, the project has been designed to irrigate 45 lakh acres for two crops in a year besides meeting drinking water requirement of 70 per cent of the state. BJP MLA Raja Singh\u200b injured as poli.description: HYDERABAD: Tension prevailed at Jummerat Bazar Y junction in Hyderabad during the early hours of Thursday when BJP workers led by MLA Raja Singh tried to replace freedom fighter Rani Avanti Bai's statue with a new one. At 12.30am, Shahinayatgunj SI S Gurumurthy received information that local BJP workers were trying to replace Rani Avanti Bai's statue at Jummerat Bazar Y Junction with a new one. As no permission was sought for the installation of the new statue, the SI reached the spot and seized the crane brought to the spot by the supporters of Raja Singh to remove the old statue. According to police Raja Singh, along with his associates tried to replace the Rani Avanti Bai's statue without permission. "The supporters of Raja Singh who were trying to remove the old statue alerted him. Raja Singh reached the spot and confronted police. Meanwhile, the new 25-feet statue of Rani Avanti Bai was brought to the spot from Ganga Bowli and en route, Raja Singh and his supporters damaged two police vehicles," Goshamahal ACP M Narendar Reddy said. MLA Raja Singh alleged that when he and his supporters were trying to replace the old statue of Rani Avanti Bai with a new one, police personnel including, Goshamahal ACP Narendar Reddy, Asif Nagar ACP, Narsimha Reddy, SIs Gurumurthy and Ravi Kumar, attacked him with sticks, causing a bleeding injury on his head. However, police clarified that the injuries suffered by Raja Singh were self-inflicted. "MLA Raja Singh abused us. Later, he picked up a boulder and hit his head," the ACP said. The MLA underwent treatment at Osmania General Hospital as an outpatient. During this period, the MLAs supporters replaced the old statue with the new one. Police registered a case against Raja Singh and others under sections, 143, 145, 147, 153, 152, 153-a, 353 r/w 149 IPC. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tollywood will get its very own funny de.description: 'Sai Srinivasa Athreya’ sounds more like the name of your regular Telugu boy next door, than that of a private agent. But then Agent Sai Srinivasa Athreya isn’t your average detective drama filled with larger-than-life characters pulling off unbelivable stunts. “I was very clear that I wanted both my story and the characters to be as real as possible. That makes it so much easier for people to connect with the character. There’ll be no fancy gadgets, high-speed chases, high-octane sequences, et al. Our guy is a smart detective who uses good old techniques to solve a gristly case,” says director Swaroop RSJ, who is making his debut with this film. Admittedly, he’s “a big fan” of Chiranjeevi’s 1986 blockbuster Chantabbai, and it was his dream to bring back that genre into Telugu cinema. “It has been so long since we have seen a full-blown detective film in Telugu, especially one that can also make you laugh. there have been spy films, but none like Chantabbai, where the detective happens to be a small town guy. It’s such a lovable genre — a perfect mix of comedy and drama. I wanted to make my debut with a film like this,” says the director, who’s thrilled to have found the perfect partner in his hero, Naveen Polishetty. “I’d seen Naveen’s hugely popular AIB videos and loved his comic timing. He’s such a talented actor. I had no doubt that he was the one I wanted as my hero,” says, Swaroop, who teamed up with Naveen even before the character was fully developed. “Naveen and I worked together for eight months just so I could understand his body language and mannerisms, so that I could incorporate them into the character seamlessly,” he adds. The toughest part was ensuring that his ‘detective with a sense of humour’ doesn’t end up looking like a caricature, says Swaroop. “I was very careful while writing the character of Agent Sai Srinivasa Athreya, because I know a comparison will be drawn with other amusing detectives, be it Inspector Jacques Clouseau of Pink Panther or Sherlock Holmes. I’ve done my best to incorporate a sense of humour in the story, without making it seem like a parody. The entire cast and crew of the film is new and every day on the set was a challenge. But at the end of it all, we have an amazing film at hand. I can’t wait for people to watch it.” Produced by Rahul Yadav Nakka under Swadharm Entertainment, Agent Sai Srinivasa Athreya is releasing tomorrow.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. \nA Hyderabadi artist\u2019s musings on.description: Art-enthusiasts of Hyderabad made way to Kalakriti Art Gallery for an exhbition which displayed the art series, ‘Life Is A Deck of Cards’ created by Avijit Dutta. True to its name, the collection of artworks depicted various stages of life in the form of a deck of cards, complete with two jokers. Spotted at the do were noted artists like Jagdish Chintala, and Laxman Aelay interacting with Avijit as he showcased his work. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Telangana high court bids adieu to Justi.description: HYDERABAD: The full court of Telangana high court comprising all its judges, along with law officers, registrars, lawyers and staff bid farewell to Justice V Ramasubramanian who was elevated as chief justice of Himachal Pradesh high court. Telangana advocate general BS Prasad described him as an erudite scholar, a jurist with a vision and also a Tamil literary figure. Narrating the love the advocates have for him, the AG said: "The Bar stands up today with choked throats and tear-filled eyes to bid farewell to one of the finest judges who served this high court”. The AG recalled some of the brilliant judgements delivered by Justice Ramasubramanian on the question of infringement of a trademark through Google’s ad-words, on the concept of shared parenting, on the principles of international law and the enforceability of a foreign court’s order in India, on the need to evolve a foolproof mechanism to prevent honour killings etc. He has a unique style of writing judgments that are laced with humor, lucidity is the hallmark, the AG said. He urged the judge to come back to Hyderabad after retirement and start his further endeavors from here. Acting chief Justice Raghavendra Singh Chauhan said that he was amazed at the vast amount of knowledge Justice Ramasubramanian possessed on various subjects including religious texts. Justice Ramasubramanian thanked all the judges, advocates and staff for the cooperation they extended and for the wonderful tenure he had here. His wife Saraswati Subramanian and son Darshan were present in the court hall that was packed with advocates. Scores of advocates have been thronging his chamber since morning and in the evening the HC advocates association bid him farewell separately. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rescued camels on their way home.description: HYDERABAD: Eight of the nine camels that were smuggled to Hyderabad from Rajasthan for slaughter on May 26, started their journey back home after being rescued by the police and a city-based NGO. The orders to transport the camels to Rajasthan were given after Greater Hyderabad Society for Prevention of Animal Cruelty (GHSPCA)—which was part of the rescue operation—and People for Animals, filed a revision before the high court. The camels—dehydrated and injured—were rescued by animal activists and police at Gachibowli. They were later shifted to the GHMC animal shelter in West Zone. Volunteers said one of the camels succumbed to its injuries while undergoing treatment after the rescue. “The camels were stuffed like soft toys in one truck. They were all badly dehydrated and injured when we found them. One camel had died while undergoing treatment,” said Soudharm Bhandari, Coordinator, GHSPCA. Bhandari states that rampant illegal sale and slaughtering of camels has become a common phenomenon in the Hyderabad for quite some time. “Several camels are gruesomely slaughtered in contravention of the rules and several sections of the law. After every rescue, we find that the camels are dehydrated, starved, damaged hooves and unattended injuries with maggots eating away their exposed tissue,” said Mahip Jain of GHSPCA adding that in many cases there are pregnant, lactating and calves as well. The voluntary groups that took care of the camels for the last one month had arranged to transport them to the PFA shelter at Sirohi in Rajasthan, a nearly 1,500 km drive in two trucks with four camels in each vehicle. “The transportation of the remaining eight camels, in two trucks started on Tuesday from Hyderabad and the animals will reach Rajasthan by Friday evening. The camels are being accompanied by our volunteers and a veterinarian to monitor their health,” Bhandari said. A case of animal cruelty was registered against the truck drivers after the vehicles carrying the animals were apprehended. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nHyderabadi cricketer T Suman gets hitc.description: BAND, BAAJA AND BARAAT  In a grand wedding ceremony on Friday evening, Hyderabadi cricketer T Suman finally tied the knot with his lady love Julaiikha Patnam. Looking gorgeous in a green Kanjeevaram saree, she entered the hall in a palanquin, while Suman — all smiles at the sight of his bride-to-be — also made quite an entry with band, baaja and baraatis. “It feels amazing to be married, honestly! I never thought I’d have such a grand ceremony and it feels nice to get a warm welcome from Julaiikha’s family,” said Suman excitedly.  STARS OF THE EVENING  Suman’s parents Laxminaranyana and Anjali, and Julaiikha’s parents Pawan Kumar and Jyothisree were seen welcomed the guests warmly. Actor Balakrishna and with his wife Vasundhara Devi were one of the first to arrive and gave their best wishes to the couple. Also spotted mingling with the guests was former cricketer VVS Laxman.  FOODIES' DELIGHT  Guests were treated to a lavish spread — from pizza to chaat to Indian delicacies. With faludas, juices and ice creams, the dessert counter was a hit. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Yoga Day.description: The world marks the fifth edition of International Day of Yoga on June 21, 2019. Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the main event in Ranchi and performed yoga along with 18,000 people. It was on September 27, 2014 that PM Modi proposed a dedicated day for Yoga to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA). In 2015, the first International Day of Yoga was observed. Here's a look at different yoga styles and its growing popularity worldwide. Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

NIFT, Hyderabad housekeeping staff alleg.description: HYDERABAD: Women employees from the housekeeping department at National Institute of Fashion Technology (NIFT), who had alleged an employee of sexual harassment, agreed to resume work if the alleged assaulter was removed. Fifty-six women employees from NIFT had alleged that they were unceremoniously fired by the institute after they complained about sexual harassment. “We were fired from NIFT though a few of us had been working at the institute for several years. This, only because we raised an alarm over sexual harassment,” said Ratna Kumari, supervisor of the housekeeping staff. The staff said the man would touch them inappropriately, click photos without their consent and seek sexual favours. Following this, few staff members registered a complaint with the administration. While the accused continues to serve the institute, NIFT officials claim that they are awaiting the internal complaints committee report to initiate initiate action. “We have not terminated any housekeeping employee. We follow all standard operating procedures to deal with sexual harassment complaints. The director who works out of Delhi is expected to visit the institute on Thursday. The issue will be taken up with him,” said GHS Prasad, joint director, NIFT. “At our end, we have conducted all investigations. We even collected CCTV footage from the institute. But since it’s a central government institute, we could not arrest the accused without any permission and concrete proof,” said Y Nageshwar Rao, inspector of police, Madhapur. Eamcet registrations from June 24.description: Hyderabad: Registration to seek admission into engineering, agriculture and medicine courses will commence on June 24, the Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University, Hyderabad (JNTU-H), said on Thursday. The Eamcet admission committee met on Thursday and fixed the schedule for the first phase of counselling. As per the notification, online filing of basic information, payment of processing fee and booking of slots to select helpline centre to attend certificate verification would be held from June 24 to July 1, the varsity said in a press release. Certificate verification for candidates who booked slots would be held from June 27 to July 3 and candidates can exercise their web options from June 27 to July 4. Provisional seat allotment will be made on July 6 and candidates can pay tuition fee and self-report through the website from July 6 to July 12. Further details about the next phases of admission will be made available on the Eamcet website on June 24. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nHyderabadis headbanging and death grow.description: Papri.Paul@timesgroup.com  Hyderabad’s metalheads had a gala time at a cultural fest hosted by IIT Kanpur at a city hotspot on Sunday evening. Competing with each other for the semi finals in IIT Kanpur next month, the bands went all in with guitars, drums and of course, some intense head banging. Sipping on their cocktails and beers, the guests basked in the all-metal glory. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

T-Germany pact on seeds extended.description: Hyderabad: The bilateral agreement signed by the Telangana government with German federal ministry for development of seed sector in the state has been extended for three more years. The agreement, which was signed in 2017, ended this month. The German federal ministry also said it would support the state government in setting up a global seed valley at Banda Mylaram in Medak district. Addressing a press meet on Wednesday, agriculture minister S Niranjan Reddy said there will not be any transfer of patents on seeds to Germany, but the state will get equipped with better techniques on seed development. He said the state government is coming up with a food processing policy soon to give boost to farmers and entrepreneurs. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. No PM supported AP like Modi, quitting N.description: Following the four TDP Rajya Sabha MPs’ move to merge forces with the BJP, former union minister Y S Chowdary speaks to U Sudhakar Reddy on the allegations against him and Chandrababu’s decision to quit the NDA. Excerpts: * How can we see you and your party colleagues move to join BJP at a time when you are facing the heat of central investigation and enforcement agencies?A week ago I met Prime Minister Narendra Modi and asked him to examine the so-called allegations against me. I met PM Modi on Thursday too when finance minister Arun Jaitley got it examined with all agencies and he was satisfied. The PM also has the details of verification. I am the owner of my truth. In the interest of the nation, I have joined BJP * You are saying that there is no case against you?There is no cheating or forgery or any kind of case against me. No bank has filed a case. I am clean. I have an impeccable track record. I excelled in business and inspired several entrepreneurs. * Are the remaining two TDP MPs of Rajya Sabha also joining BJP?I am the leader of the party in Rajya Sabha. Most of the MPs followed me. I neither induced nor influenced them. It is their wish and will to join BJP. Two other RS MPs of TDP may also take a decision soon. * Did the TDP do a post-mortem examination after the election results?Coming out of NDA was a big blunder committed by the TDP. But we had to follow the then leader’s decision. In India, no central government under any prime minister had supported Andhra Pradesh like the NDA had for four years. I had internally opposed the decision several times. Not only getting out of NDA, but also blaming central government is wrong. In a cooperative federal system, no PM or FM can give funds at the cost of other states. * Did you demand the resignation of Naidu after the general election? Are leaving him even though he gave you a Rajya Sabha seat?Who am I to demand his resignation? No doubt Chandrababu is a visionary and a hardworking leader. Leaving him is an incorrect word. He has to retire. Does anyone need to stay aboard a sinking Titanic till the last minute? I had my own plans to do something. I am a person who has accomplished everything in life. My children are disciplined and they got married and settled well. There are 3,000 to 4,000 people taking a salary from the companies I founded. I want to be active in politics so I joined BJP. * Do you think elevating Nara Lokesh’s elevation as minister and general secretary of the party has affected the outcome of the elections?I cannot blame him. If the general secretary elections are held in a democratic process those who have fire in the belly like me would have contested. Chandrababu is a great person but he was misled by a few officers. Though he is out of the country, I was in touch with him and held discussions. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. TDP implodes as four of its Rajya Sabha.description: HYDERABAD: In a surprise move, four of the six Telugu Desam Party (TDP) MPs in Rajya Sabha joined the BJP on Thursday in the presence of its newly-appointed working president, J P Nadda. The MPs, including Y S Chowdary, C M Ramesh, Garikapati Mohan Rao and T G Venkatesh, also gave a letter to Vice-President and Rajya Sabha chairman, M Venkaiah Naidu, requesting him to allow the TDP parliamentary party to merge into the BJP. The move has come at a time when TDP supremo and former Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu is holidaying in Europe. Chowdary, Ramesh and Rao were among Naidu's closest aides. After making the MPs join BJP, Nadda told reporters that party president Amit Shah had accepted the merger proposal. TDP was virtually decimated in the recent general elections as it won only 23 assembly seats in a House of 175. Also, the party got just three Lok Sabha seats out of 25. Sources close to Chowdary told TOI that at least 12 of the newly elected TDP MLAs and one Lok Sabha MP were in touch with BJP leaders and could switch sides any time. "Coming out of NDA was a big blunder by TDP," Chowdary told TOI. "I had then internally opposed it. But we had to follow Naidu's decision. No central government had supported Andhra Pradesh like NDA had for four years. There is no scope for TDP in Andhra Pradesh now." Naidu had walked out of the NDA in March last year, apparently over Andhra Pradesh not being given the special category status. He had then assiduously worked towards bringing all opposition parties under one umbrella to fight BJP. Chowdary had recently appeared before CBI for questioning in a case related to a Chennai company, which is being investigated for fraud by the Enforcement Directorate and CBI. He had told officials that he had nothing to do with the company. CBI had also raided Chowdhary's house in Hyderabad in May. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Row erupts over SI training time-table.description: HYDERABAD: A few cops at Telangana State Police Academy (TSPA) on Thursday tried to create an issue when their top brass told them to stay back overnight to complete the task of finalising the time-table for the training classes to be held for the newly-inducted SIs. The TSPA top brass explained that the officers concerned have to complete their work at the earliest given the deadline. “The faculty members are supposed to prepare the time-table for a one-year induction training programme starting in July. Those who have work pending need to complete it by staying back,” said TSPA Deputy Director B Naveen Kumar. tnn Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Hyderabad school sends students back due.description: HYDERABAD: Scarcity of water forced the Global Edge School to declare holiday on Thursday at its Kukatpally branch. “We have been facing water crisis for the last few days, since we could not get a water tanker even on Wednesday, we had to declare a holiday on Thursday,” said an official who refused to identify herself. According to the official, an SMS alert was issued to all the parents on Thursday morning. However, a few parents who were unaware of the water issue at the campus, were asked to take their wards back. The Global Edge School, Kukatpally has more than 2,500 students and is affiliated to the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) since 2005. The school management’s decision to shut it down due to water scarcity received flak from child rights activists in the city. “It is very unfortunate that the school management had to declare a holiday due to water shortage. The school levies heavy fee on parents and has failed to provide basic water supply for use,” said Achyutha Rao, honorary president of Balala Hakkula Sangham, adding that the school management should take up the responsibility of ensuring that there is sufficient water in the school premises. District-level officers from the school education department admitted that schools are struggling to manage without adequate water supply. Schools in rural areas too are hit as they have been asked to fetch water from the neighbourhood to keep the toilets functional. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

In a first, Telangana high court sets up.description: HYDERABAD: In a digital initiative that was taken up for the first time in the country’s judiciary, Telangana high court and State Bank of India (SBI) entered into an MoU to facilitate online payment of court fee by litigants and lawyers. Earlier, people who wanted to pay court fee used to go to banks and transfer them into government account. Even cheque payment, too, used to be lengthy and time consuming mode. Now, online payment has been integrated into the servers of both SBI and high court. One can make the payment either through debit card, credit card or net-banking, and the payment particulars will be reflected in the records within no time. Litigants and lawyers can even take a print-out of their payment as proof, said an SBI officer who said that this digital initiative was first-of-its-kind introduced in the judiciary. E-Courts project may have initiated many other digital facilities, but the court fee payment has always been manual. Acting Chief Justice Raghavendra Singh Chauhan and SBI chief general manager Om Prakash Misra were present during the signing of the MoU at the high court judges’ lounge on Wednesday evening. Registrar general A Venkateswar Reddy from the high court and deputy general manager Geetha S Pillai from SBI corporate wing signed the MoU. Justices Sanjay Kumar, MS Ramachandra Rao, A Rajashekher Reddy, P Naveen Rao, G Sri Devi, Shameem Akther and others participated in the event. SBI general manager V Ramesh and registrar (IT), high court, D Hemanth Kumar coordinated the effort. Terming it a proud moment in the history of the high court, Acting Chief Justice Chauhan said, “The more we bring in technology into judiciary, the better it is for litigants, lawyers and general public.” He hoped that Telangana high court would scale many more digital heights in the future. India Pakistan news.description: NEW DELHI/ISLAMABAD: India dismissed on Thursday as "fake news" the suggestion in Pak media that it was looking to resume talks with the hostile neighbour and asserted that there was no dilution of its position that Islamabad needed to take verifiable and irreversible action against terrorism for the dialogue to resume. Responding to Pakistan PM Imran Khan's congratulatory letter after he assumed office for the second time, PM Narendra Modi wrote back on June 12 expressing India's desire to have normal and cooperative relations with all its neighbours, including Pakistan, while stressing that "for this, it is important to build an environment of trust, free of terror, violence and hostility". Foreign minister S Jaishankar also wrote to his Pakistani counterpart S M Qureshi, again only in response to the latter's congratulatory letter, emphasising the need for an atmosphere "free from the shadow of terror and violence". The emphasis on the need for Pakistan to rein in terror as a pre-condition for re-engagement was in keeping with the stand which saw Modi refrain from engaging with Imran Khan at the just-concluded SCO summit in Kyrgyzstan. Yet, the Pakistani media chose to interpret the contents of the letters of Modi and Jaishankar as reflecting India's desire to re-engage. The foreign ministry in Delhi quickly scotched the suggestion. "There was complete distortion and an attempt to peddle fake news (in the way it was reported). The letters only reiterated India's old position that it wants normal and cooperative relations with all countries in South Asia and that it was important to create an environment free of terror and violence for it. There was no mention of any sort of dialogue with Pakistan," said MEA spokesperson Raveesh Kumar, adding that India will not be fooled by any cosmetic action against terror by Islamabad. Emphasising that both the letters were written in as per the "established diplomatic practice", Kumar said: "In their messages, they have highlighted that India seeks normal and cooperative relations with all neighbours, including Pakistan." In his letter, Modi had said that India remained committed to operationalising early an "all-year-round" Kartarpur corridor. Touching upon it, Kumar said India had already held three technical-level discussions with Pakistan and was currently awaiting clarification from Islamabad over a few issues it had raised. Puzzlingly, later in the evening, Pakistan's foreign ministry, which had kept quiet through the day, also sought to play down the speculation about the import of the letters. While responding to a question, the spokesperson said, "It was an established practice for the leadership to congratulate new office holders and for them to respond." "Pakistan's position on the way forward in relations with India was clear and well-known and did not require repetition," said the spokesperson, adding that the "vision of peace, progress and prosperity of South Asia could be advanced by peacefully resolving all outstanding disputes, including Jammu & Kashmir, and moving away from dynamic of confrontation to cooperation". Earlier in the day, sources in the Pakistan foreign office had said that Modi and Jaishankar had responded positively to recent letters from their Pakistani counterparts by conveying New Delhi's desire to engage with all countries, including Pakistan, for elimination of terrorism and prosperity of the region. "India has always prioritised peace and human development, and sought to maintain cordial relations with all regional powers," Modi and Jaishankar maintained, according to FO sources. Both leaders, according to FO sources, called for special attention on elimination of terrorism in the region and said the issue must be a core focus in all future talks. They have also appreciated sentiments from Pakistan in their letters, the FO sources added. Modi's letter was in response to a congratulatory letter from Khan in which he had underscored Pakistan's vision of working for "durable peace and stability in South Asia with peaceful resolution of all outstanding disputes, including J&K". Don\u2019t take action against actor Siv.description: HYDERABAD: Justice G Sri Devi of Telangana high court on Wednesday directed police not to take action against actor Sivaji till June 26. The judge gave the interim order while hearing a petition filed by the actor urging the court to quash the FIR against him in the TV9 shares’ sale episode. Sivaji claimed that he bought 40,000 shares from TV9 channel’s former CEO Ravi Prakash at Rs 20 lakh and had also approached NCLT, urging it to stall the takeover of TV9 by the new management. Police suspect Sivaji was planted by Prakash to stall the change in management. Public prosecutor C Pratap Reddy opposed relief to Sivaji and said he was evading police and not responding to the notices served. As judgment in Prakash anticipatory bail plea was reserved, he urged the court to adjourn the matter for a few days. The judge posted the case to June 26. Meanwhile, Justice Devi reserved judgment in a plea filed by Prakash seeking anticipatory bail. Pratap told the court that there was no truth in the allegations that the management of TV9 had resorted to hawala payments while selling 90% stake of the old management to the new management. It was bought for Rs 500 crore and the whole amount was paid in white through bank, he said, refuting the allegations made by Prakash. The public prosecutor said the action of the former CEO in selling the logo of the TV for Rs 99,000 was done with an intention to creating trouble for the new management. Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Daily wager rapes minor girl in Uppal.description: HYDERABAD: A day after the rape and murder of a nine-month-old baby girl in Warangal shook the entire state, another shocking case was reported on Thursday in Uppal wherein a minor girl was raped by a daily wager. The nine-year-old victim, a class IV student in a government school, was playing outside her house when the accused lured her to an isolated under construction building and sexually assaulted her. “The incident occurred at around 11.30am. When the girl came back home crying, her mother noticed injuries on her private parts,” said Uppal inspector P Venkateshwarlu. The victim’s family hails from Khammam district and moved to Uppal four months ago. The girl’s parents are daily wage labourers. “Locals caught the accused and beat him up. He later fled from his rented house. Our teams are searching for him,” the inspector added. The victim was shifted to Gandhi Hospital. A case has been registered under IPC sections and relevant sections of Pocso Act. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

I was a lot like Raju in real life; I wa.description: With his neatly parted oily hair and thick rimmed glasses, Chetan Maddineni looks every bit the front bench nerd in First Rank Raju. Interestingly, he didn’t have to go far looking for inspiration, ’cos he used to be a nerd in real life, he admits. “I drew inspiration from life because, to be honest, I too was a lot like my character Raju when I was a child. I wanted nothing more than getting that first rank, even if it meant mugging up the whole syllabus. It was only when my family shifted to the US that I learnt how important it is to balance life in a better manner,” says the actor. A remake of the Kannada hit First Rank Raju, the Telugu version will see Chetan play a hero the Telugu audiences can relate to. “I did watch the original for reference, but I have made the character totally my own. This is my interpretation of how Raju would be would be if he lived in Hyderabad. I remember how I would feel when I scored well, so I brought in some of my personal experiences as well.” His character might look boring, but his love story is quirky, promises Chetan. “The chemistry between me and Kashish Vohra is something to watch out for. It was really good shooting with her. In fact, we’d joke about how she was the ‘First Rank Rani’ on the set, because she would learn all her dialogues by-heart since she doesn’t speak Telugu,” says Chetan, laughing. Talking about the love track, he adds, “The love story here is not the run-of-the-mill boy chasing girl; it’s more of her character trying to put up with Raju’s idiosyncrasies.” Chetan rounds off saying First Rank Raju is a film that has something for everyone: “The journey of Raju is something that will seem familiar to all the youngsters. a geek trying to be cool and, finally finding himself — this character is one that will be relatable to kids and an eye-opener for parents.” Produced by Manjunath V Kandkur under Dolphin Entertainment, First Rank Raju is releasing tomorrow.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Kaleshwaram to lessen Hyderabad's water.description: HYDERABAD: The Telangana government’s flagship irrigation project, Kaleshwaram Lift Irrigation Scheme, is expected to significantly mitigate water shortage issues in Hyderabad. The project is also likely to boost economic growth in the metropolitan region given that 16 tmcft of water will be reserved solely for industrial needs around the city once the project is completed in entirety. Of the nearly 200 tmcft of water that will be diverted from the Godavari as part of the project, about 30 tmcft is allotted for Hyderabad. As of now, the city gets 30 tmcft of water from the Krishna and the Godavari and 440 million gallons per day (MGD) is supplied to the city. “Kaleshwaram project is the lifeline of Hyderabad as it gives assured water supply to the metropolitan city even if the city expands up to the proposed regional ring road (RRR) and also the population of the city is doubles (touching two crore) in the future,” Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation commissioner and Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWS&SB) managing director Dana Kishore told TOI. HMWS&SB has taken up construction of a reservoir at Keshavapuram village near Sharmirpet with a capacity of 10 tmcft which will receive Kaleshwaram water from Konda Pochamma Sagar Reservoir at Markook, about 30 km from the city. Similarly another reservoir of the same capacity at Devalamma Nagaram of Choutuppal is in the works.“Since the state is planning to shift industries beyond ORR, apart from villages, new industries will also be given water,” Dana Kishore said. And city girl Sharon did just that. her birthday bash was an exclusive affair for “just close friends”. Looking pretty in smart casuals, Sharon, was flanked by her buddies as they enjoyed the classy afternoon soiree. The girls bonded over scrumptious lunch, before calling it a day. Kullu road accident.description: MANALI: At least 44 people have died and 29 sustained injured on Thursday when a bus fell into a gorge in Himachal's Kullu district. Kullu superintendent of police (SP) Shalini Agnihotri said several women and kids were among the injured. The vehicle had started its journey from the Banjar bus stand around 4pm and covered barely 2km when it met with an accident. The driver apparently lost control while negotiating a sharp turn at the Bhiyoth Mor, which has a gradient of more than 75 degrees. Eyewitnesses said the bus veered off the road to scrape the mountain face before hurtling down the gorge. Local residents and police personnel faced difficulty locating and extricating the bodies from the mangled mass of metal. Parts of the vehicle were strewn over a wide swathe of the bottom of the gorge. Between 2009 and 2018, Himachal Pradesh recorded 30,993 road accidents in which 11,561 people were killed and 53,909 injured. This year alone, as many as 430 people died in 1,168 road accidents in the state till May 31. Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Warangal: 9-month-old abducted by drunk.description: WARANGAL: A drunk man kidnapped a nine-month-old girl from a house, sexually assaulted her and then throttled her in Hanamkonda in Warangal early on Wednesday. A rape case has been booked as there were injuries on the child’s private parts. The 22-year-old accused had abducted the baby at 1.30 am from the terrace of the house in Kumarapalli where the family was sleeping. “As the ground floor and first floor was locked, he went to the terrace where the family was sleeping. As the child was in deep sleep she did not cry when he took her out of the house, ’’ ACP (Hanamkonda) D Chandraiah told TOI. Around 1.45 am, the family members noticed the baby was missing and started searching for her. Both police and locals, including family members, formed search teams and it was the girl’s uncle who noticed the accused carrying a baby covered with a towel. When the uncle questioned him, the accused dropped the baby and ran, but was eventually chased and caught. The man was thrashed by the locals before he was handed over to the police. The baby was rushed to the hospital, but doctors declared her ‘brought dead’. “The man was drunk when he was caught. There were injuries on the girl’s private parts and he confessed that he sexually abused her,” the ACP said Police have booked a case under IPC Sections 366 (kidnapping), 302 (murder), 379 (theft), besides Protection of Children from Sexual Offence Act (POCSO). The accused had also stolen a couple of mobile phones of the victim’s family members. As the news spread, hundreds of locals protested at Hanamkonda police station junction demanding stringent punishment against the accused. Traffic had to be diverted for a few hours due to protests. Cyberabad motorists, beware! You may los.description: HYDERABAD: In a first such move, aimed to make driving in the city streets safer, the Cyberabad police have recommended revoking licences of 50 drivers, involved in reckless driving, often leading to deaths. After analysing CC television footage and investigating the accidents, the cops say the 50 drivers, mostly truck and cab drivers, barring a few private car and two-wheelers, will have to give up their driving licence. Some two-wheelers and private car owners also figure in the list, police said. Once a licence is revoked, he or she will become ineligible to drive any vehicle. After brainstorming on ways to curb fatal accidents, a decision was taken by Cyberabad police to write letters, recommending cancellation of driving licences of those motorists, who were involved in deliberate negligence like wrong-side driving, cell phone driving or jumping signals, leading to accidents. “We have sent proposals to the transport department, asking them to revoke their driving licences as their deliberate negligence have led to accidents. We are waiting for a reply from the transport department,’’ an officer in the Cyberabad police told TOI. Till date, licences of motorists have been suspended, when they were caught either for drunken driving or other offences. Now, the officials have decided to invoke provisions under the MV Act to revoke licences of erring motorists. The recommendation was made citing Section 19 of the Motor Vehicle Act, which authorises the licensing authority to disqualify a person from holding a driving licence or revoke the licence. While transport authorities from the districts have already replied in the affirmative in some cases, police say they are waiting for responses from the Regional Transport Authority (RTA) in the city. In the past, Cyberabad police sought explanation from RTA on how driving licence were issued to motorists who had multiple traffic violations against them. The RTA official reportedly gave an explanation that since those motorists were eligible to apply and they passed the requisite exam, they issued them the permit. Police officials said that system of assigning points for various traffic violations is yet to be implemented for road accidents. “Though, as per points system, for every road accident, a motorist is supposed to get five penalty points, but now accident information is not being integrated with traffic wing, yet,” a source said. Narendra Modi.description: RANCHI: Appealing to people to take yoga to all sections of society, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said yoga is above everything, as he performed various asanas with around 40,000 enthusiasts at the Prabhat Tara ground here to mark the fifth International Day of Yoga. Modi also urged people to make yoga an integral part of life. International Yoga Day 2019: PM urges country to embrace Yoga"We should make efforts to take yoga from cities to villages and tribal areas. Yoga is above religion, caste, colour, gender and region, it is above everything," he told the gathering. Yoga is ancient and modern. It is constant and evolving. For centuries, the essence of Yoga has remained the same… https://t.co/isvMOUTrn8— PMO India (@PMOIndia) 1561080804000The main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Best pictures from International Yoga Day 2019"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Follow live updates: International Yoga DayThe main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Amit Shah credits PM for taking yoga to the world"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Expressing concern that young people are becoming vulnerable to heart ailments, Modi said, "Yoga can play a huge role in tackling the issue and hence, this year's theme is 'Yoga for Heart'." "It is painful to read about alcoholism, substance abuse, diabetes and other things, adding yoga offers a solution to these problems," he added. He stressed that for yoga to become popular, infrastructure for it must be strengthened and said the government was working towards it. "Peace and harmony are related to yoga. People across the world must practice it," Modi said. The prime minister had arrived in Ranchi on Thursday night. On his way out of the venue, Modi shook hands with several participants, including school children, who reached out to the prime minister over barricades. The International Day of Yoga is being celebrated annually on June 21 since 2015.
