\nA mesmerising Fusion of sur, taal and.description: Papri.Paul@timesgroup.com  The polyrhythmic notes of jazz fused with the ethno-musical notes of Baul Lokogeeti (devotional folk songs from Bengal) formed an interesting ensemble in a very unique fusion concert — One World Fusion 2016. True to its name, the concert held at Ravindra Bharati, saw some of the best names from the music world join hands to mesmerise Hyderabad’s music lovers.  eminent sax player George Brooks, santoor maestro Pt.Tarun Bhattachary, flute maestro Pravin Godkhindi, tabla marvel Pt.Shubhankar Banerjee, drumming sensation Gino Banks and prominent keyboard player Sagar Paul blended their artistic outflow with the famous couple, Sahaj Ma Baul, an eminent Baul Singer and Utpal Faqir, a famous baul dutara and banjo player. The amalgam that apposed diametrically divergent and distinguishing styles was enthralling, to say the least.  the group started with Vande Mataram fused with Sare Jahan Se Achha, keeping in mind the Independene Day fervour. Sahaj Ma’s deep voice and Godkhindi’s classical vistar resounded in the auditorium. A peek into each performer’s individual streams left listeners spellbound. Brooks’ jazz fare with hints of Indian sounds, with tabla, drums and santoor thrown into the mix, was a hypnotic hybrid, undeniably unlike anything the audience had ever heard before.  Pt Tarun Bhattacharya strummed his santoor, exploring myriad challenging cross-rhythmic patterns, inviting a parallel response from his fellow musicians in tabla, drums, flute and saxophone. The jugalbandi between Pt.Shubhankar Banerjee on tabla and Gino Banks on drums left the audience craving for more. Pravin Godkhindi, who is the only Indian to play the world’s largest flute, the contrabass, captivated the audience with his euphonious flute renditions. Sahaj Ma and Utpal Faqir transported the audience to rural Bengal with the song, Chander gaye chaand legeche, amra jene korbo ki, by a Bengali Baul saint, Lalon Fakir.  The musicians followed each other on stage, improvising to suit each other’s style, yet, not letting their individualistic style get lost in the blend. As the musicians traversed through intricate patterns to attain a crescendo, the auditorium thundered with undying applause.  Sahaj Ma and Utpal Faqir broke into a slow dance in the midst of their performances. Sagar Paul could not stop himself rocking to and fro with the rhythm throughout the concert. Even George Brooks swayed his hips from time to time enjoying the performance. They all looked like a bunch of buddies who sat together to jam, unmindful of the 500 awestruck eyes watching them.  A splendid musical treat, indeed! Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kaleshwaram result of sacrifices made by.description: HYDERABAD: On the eve of the inauguration of Kaleshwaram project, former irrigation minister T Harish Rao on Thursday released an emotional statement saying the project was a big step in the direction of realisation of the dream that was at the core of separate Telangana movement. “This is a result of the struggle of the people and the sacrifices made by martyrs for Telangana statehood,” he said. The Siddipet MLA said the credit for the project should go to chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao. Harish Rao said when an irrigation project was deliberately designed by the previous governments, so that it could get caught in wrangles between various states, it was KCR who redesigned it. Describing KCR as ‘Aparabhageerathudu’, he said he had approached Maharashtra and settled the water issue amicable so that the Kaleshwaram project could be constructed. “I would like to thank KCR for supervising the construction of the project and getting it done in record time,” he said. Harish Rao said project engineers, employees and workers had worked through all seasons and in difficult weather conditions and congratulated them for their work. “I salute the farmers of Telangana who are overwhelmed by the inauguration of the project. I pray to God that the dream of a green Telangana be realised,” he said. Harish Rao ended his statement with ‘Jai Telangana., Jai Kisan’. Nowhere in the statement did he mention that he was the irrigation minister in the previous government under chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao and worked on the execution of the project. It may be mentioned here that in KCR’s second time after the assembly elections in December 2018, Harish Rao was not inducted into the cabinet. KCR himself kept the irrigation portfolio. The project will be inaugurated on Friday. Meanwhile, Former union minister and BJP leader Bandaru Dattatreya said the Telangana government was hurriedly inaugurating the Kaleshwaram project without completing it. "The three completed barrages Medigadda, Annaram and Sundilla and other works constitute only 20 per cent of the entire project. The balance works in the Phase I about 30 per cent are at snail pace, land acquisition was not completed for the balance 50 per cent of the works," the former minister said. He said when the project was conceived, the cost was about Rs 38,000 crore but the Telangana government enhanced the project cost in the name of redesigning. Dattatreya demanded the state government to place the detailed project report of Kaleshwaram project before the public and also demanded to publish a white paper on the irrigation project costs (both original and revised) and amount spent so far. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Clip of midday meal being cooked near to.description: Hyderabad: Child rights activist came down heavily on the state government for failing to provide basic facilities at anganwadi centres after a video of a woman cooking near a washroom at a center went viral. The supplies for the midday meal could be seen stored inside the toilet. In the video being circulated on social media sites, the anganwadi’s helper is seen preparing the day’s meal near the washroom. The centre is being run from the committee hall. “How can they store supplies in the washroom and feed children using those supplies,” questioned a man, a resident of the locality. Explaining the pathetic situation in which children are made to study, he said that the Anganwadi center is being run in the corridor of the committee hall for the past five years. “The TRS government has been in power for more than five years now and they are least bothered to take care of this children,” said a resident. He added, “Parents enrolled their kids in this center after local leaders and officials promised that they are building a new Anganwadi center. However, there are no facilities here and children continue to study without even having basic amenities in place.” According to the child-right activists, the children studying in this school belongs to Gandhi Girijan Basthi and are forced to move to this committee hall located in Ravindra Nagar Colony by the local leaders. They demanded that the state shifts students studying in this center to a better school with proper infrastructure. “When the women and child welfare department is spending crores of rupees on Anganwadis, why are these children made to live in such pathetic conditions from morning to evening. The state should immediately initiate action against officials concerned and monitor funds released to Anganwadis,” said Achyuta Rao, honorary president, Balala Hakula Sangham. The Anganwadi center is said to have 32 students with a teacher and a helper. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Vents sealed during repairs, Hyderabad f.description: HYDERABAD: Not just potholes and craters, flyovers in the city have a new set of problems to deal with: waterlogging. Thanks to shoddy road repair and restoration works, flyovers are likely to face inundation this monsoon, warn experts. While executing the works, contractors laid bitumen even on the vents which are supposed to drain out excess water from the flyovers. Due to the lopsided work, Begumpet, Masab Tank, PVNR, Greenlands and Telugu Thalli flyovers could face heavy waterlogging. Experts said Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) engineers should also take the blame for failing to inspect the road restoration works while they were being executed. Since a majority of the works were carried out at night, labourers, with no proper guidance and supervision, laid bitumen on the flyover vents also without realising that it would be a big hazard for commuters during the rainy season. Experts said GHMC should immediately identify the vents and remove the bitumen. “If the flyovers are left unattended, there is every likelihood of commuters tripping and hurting themselves,” a road management expert explained. Another said commuting on flyovers is bound to get worse and motorists may have to wade through one ft of stagnant water. “The pipes attached to drain out vents should be flushed out immediately to avoid waterlogging. That is one solution to begin with,” said SP Anchuri, vice-president (south), Structural Engineers World Congress. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nizam\u2019s 11-kg gold coin, diamond st.description: HYDERABAD: As some of the Nizam’s collection is put up for auction at Christie’s in New York, heritage activists recall how the world’s biggest gold coin ever minted was withdrawn from an international auction house, Hapsberg Feldmann, in Geneva in 1987, following the intervention of the Indian government. However, 32 years later, there’s no word about the 11.193kg or 1,000-mohur gold coin inherited by titular Nizam VIII, Mukarram Jah, from his grandfather and last Nizam of Hyderabad, Mir Osman Ali Khan, in 1967. The gold coin was minted during the regime of Mughal emperor Jahangir. Along with this 1,000-mohur gold coin, a 2.3kg gold coin minted during Shah Jahan’s rule, is also put up for auction. Days before the auction, the Indian government had intervened, stating that the coins are part of the national heritage. Since the unsuccessful auction in 1987, the whereabouts of the coins are not known, says city historian Dr Mohammad Safiullah. Another precious object of the Nizam that has remained a mystery for decades is the Nizam diamond. There have been no records of any international auction house selling it or putting it up for auction. The Nizam diamond, also known as little Kohinoor, was mined from the Krishna river valley in Krishna-Guntur districts. Incidentally, the Kollur diamond mine, which produced some of the famous diamonds in the world, is now submerged under the water of Pulichintala dam. The Nizam diamond was mined in 1830 and went missing a few years after the Police Action in 1948. State archival data reveals that the Nizam diamond was present in 1944 and the India office in London had sought its details. This had angered the Nizam and he refused to divulge details about the Nizam or Golconda diamond and other precious stones and gems in his possession. Dr Safiullah said the 1,000-mohur gold coin came into the hands of the Asaf Jahs after it was presented by Mughal emperor Aurangzeb to Ghaziuddin Khan Siddiqi Bahadur, father of Nizam-ul-Mulk, founder of the Asaf Jah dynasty. The 1,000-mohur coin contains Persian couplets. Such coins were minted not for circulation but for presentation to royal dignitaries or faithful nobles, he said. YSRC in soup as private site puts up gov.description: HYDERABAD: A website 'ysrvillagesevak.com' collecting Aadhaar numbers of people who want to apply for the post of 'grama volunteers' as part of village secretariat being set up by AP government has kicked off a controversy. Data security researchers alleged that the collection of Aadhaar numbers by a private website is a violation of privacy and questioned why a private portal was offering applications for recruitment of govt-appointed grama volunteers. While YSRC disowned the website, data researchers asserted that a probe should be ordered to find out who is behind it. YSRC said the website was 'fake'. The AP government plans to recruit four lakh grama volunteers by August 15. Rs 5,000 will be paid to every volunteer. The website was suspended on Wednesday evening following enquiries by data security researchers. TDP had erlier found itself in a similar embroglio when it was accused of data theft when the party's app Sevamitra collected Aadhaar and other demographic particulars of voters. Exploited maid to fly back home.description: Hyderabad: An Indian woman who was taken to Bahrain six years ago as a housemaid was exploited sexually after she told her agent she could no longer work for a particular employer. The Indian Embassy on Tuesday said a ticket on the first available flight was being arranged by the Mission to repatriat her. The woman from Nellore in Andhra Pradesh is understood to have been in contact with the embassy for the last two years seeking help. The embassy said she had been provided an emergency passport, but her request for a ticket home was still under process as she had ‘failed to provide necessary details about her agents’. Srinivas urged external affairs minister S Jaishankar to give blanket orders to embassies to help Indian housemaids stuck in the gulf to be sent home without any delays. The 39-year-old woman said she had been taken to Bahrain six years ago to work as a housemaid but was exploited. She was made to work for 13 families in a four-floor building where she had to do all the household work without pay. When she approached her agent and said she could not work there anyone, she was reportedly used as a sex slave.. The woman was forced to engage sexually with customers for two months, despite her protests. After much persuasion and pleading, the agent relieved her from working as a sex slave and employed her as a maid in different houses. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sub-inspector held for taking Rs 30,000.description: HYDERABAD: ACB sleuths on Thursday arrested Sub Inspector P Babu of Moghulpura police station for demanding and accepting Rs 30,000 bribe. Based on a complaint lodged by businessman Mohammed Abdul Raheem, ACB sleuths laid a trap and caught Babu red-handed. According to ACB officials, Raheem had a series of skirmishes with another businessman and the issue came to the notice of Moghulpura police. “Babu summoned Raheem and threatened to bind him over. He demanded Rs 30,000 bribe for not recommending Raheem and his brother’s name to Revenue Divisional Officer for taking action under Section 107 of CrPC,” an ACB official said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rain-soaked weekend on Met radar.description: HYDERABAD: The wait for rain in Telangana is set to get longer with the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD), Hyderabad on Wednesday declaring that southwest monsoon will now hit the state on either June 21 or 22. The normal date for the onset of southwest monsoon in Telangana was June 5 and was to cover the entire state in 10 days. Meteorologists claim that progress of southwest monsoon is sluggish as it has been delayed by nearly two weeks. “Unfortunately, monsoon onset is already delayed by 12 days as rains almost remained absent over the state. As a result, Telangana is rain-deficient by 57 per cent,” read a weather report issued by Skymet, an independent weather forecasting agency. According to Skymet, the intensity of rains is expected to peak from June 20, following which moderate to heavy showers would occur in the state for four to five days. “These rains will be on an intermittent basis which is expected to mark the onset of monsoon season over Telangana. Despite the significant delay, the last ten days of activity which will occur in the month of June may make up for the rain deficit,” stated Skymet. While scattered light to moderate rains are expected in initial few days, the intensity of rains is likely to increase between June 23 and June 25. Heavy rainfall is also expected to drop maximum and minimum temperatures to 34 and 24 degrees Celsius respectively by June 25. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Man held for defrauding govt.description: HYDERABAD: The president of Rural Development Society in the city was nabbed by city cops for fraudulently claiming I-T exemptions. The accused, Sanatana Ravi—a resident of Venkata Ramana Colony, Hastinapuram—claimed that the society is involved in carrying out research activities in rural areas, particularly in Nalgonda District. Based on fabricated documents, the society collected donations of Rs 37.13 crore, Rs 4.7 crore, and Rs 91.38 lakh for the financial years 2015-16, 2016-17, and 2017-18, respectively, from almost 200 donors from Mumbai, Gujarat, Kolkata. They then returned the 95 per cent of the donated amount, retaining 5 per cent as commission. The I-T department found that, in February, there was no laboratory at their premises and they did not have any proper equipment to carry out research and development. Also, a fabricated CBDT notification for approval under section 35 of the I-T Act for the year 2013, which facilitates the donors to claim 175 per cent of Tax Exemptions on the donated amount, was found. The accused, Sanatana Ravi, along with others, was arrested for cheating the government by creating fabricated CBDT notification and availed tax exemptions without a valid exemption order. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

35 yrs on, 'foreign trouble' back to wre.description: HYDERABAD: 'Foreign trouble' is back to haunt the Telugu Desam Party (TDP). This is the third time that the TDP is in a deep political crisis since its formation in 1982, and on two occasions the party president was on foreign tour at the time of the crisis. On one occasion, the TDP supremo was away from the state capital. In a surprise move, four of the six Telugu Desam Party (TDP) MPs in Rajya Sabha joined the BJP on Thursday in the presence of its newly-appointed working president, J P Nadda. The MPs, including Y S Chowdary, C M Ramesh, Garikapati Mohan Rao and T G Venkatesh, also gave a letter to Vice-President and Rajya Sabha chairman, M Venkaiah Naidu, requesting him to allow the TDP parliamentary party to merge into the BJP. August is generally regarded as a 'month of bad omen' in TDP circles, as party founder NT Rama Rao had lost chief ministership twice in August. This time, the crisis has knocked at TDP's doors two months earlier. The party had, however, survived the earlier two crisis though Rama Rao could not retain power on one occasion. The TDP was in power on two occasions. The TDP plunged into a political crisis for the first time in August 1984. Rama Rao, who was the chief minister then, went to the USA for heart surgery. In his absence, a political coup was meticulously planned and executed by his cabinet colleague Nadendla Bhaskar Rao. Rama Rao had the strength in the state assembly but he had to take to the streets to force the governor to conduct a floor test. Bhaskar Rao resigned a month later and Rama Rao was reinstated as CM. In the second political crisis in August 1995, Rama Rao was away in Srikakulam district launching 'government-at-people's-doorsteps' programme, when his son-in-law and then revenue minister N Chandrababu Naidu executed a political coup, dethroning him from chief ministership. Naidu then took over the reins of undivided AP. Rama Rao, who was forced to form NTR-TDP, died in January 1996 before the general elections held in May. The latest crisis has come at a time when incidentally TDP supremo and former Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu is holidaying in Europe. Chowdary, Ramesh and Rao were among Naidu's closest aides. The TDP was virtually decimated in the recent general elections as it won only 23 assembly seats in a House of 175. Also, the party got just three Lok Sabha seats out of 25. Sources close to Chowdary told TOI that at least 12 of the newly elected TDP MLAs and one Lok Sabha MP were in touch with BJP leaders and could switch sides any time. Blacklist contractors for shoddy repair.description: HYDERABAD: Civic activists are livid. Apart from calling for blacklisting of contractors for carrying out shoddy works, they also want stringent action against engineers for clearing the bills of contractors. “The contractors who did a shoddy repair work should be blacklisted and action should also be taken against engineers for approving the works,” said Harish Daga, a civic activist. “The amount spent on these works is taxpayers’ hard-earned money. The authorities should not have allowed the taxpayers’ money go down the drain,” said PM Sai Prasad, an RTI activist. Commuters are worried that they will have to wait long tiring hours on the road owing to traffic congestion on waterlogged flyovers. “When it rained in June first week, there was heavy waterlogging on Punjagutta flyover this year when compared to last year. I urge the authorities to take corrective measures by opening the vents before the monsoon arrives,” said B Pratyusha, a marketing executive. Karthik Reddy, a regular user of Kukatpally flyover, is not optimistic about any change in the situation. “Traffic congestion is order of the day on this flyover. Commuters also use the flyover to reach the state highway. During monsoon, the situation turns from bad to worse. I doubt anything will change,” said Karthik. A security guard at a mall said the possibility of people wading through waterlogged flyovers in the coming months cannot be ruled out. “I saw people walking through inundated flyovers when it rained heavily on June 2,” said the guard, K Shankar. Statue drama in Old Hyderabad, Raja Sing.description: HYDERABAD: Tension prevailed in the Old City in the early hours of Thursday when police tried to prevent BJP MLA Raja Singh and his followers from replacing freedom fighter Rani Avanti Bai’s statue with a new one. A case was filed against the Goshamahal MLA. The Raja Singh, who suffered a head injury in the melee, said he was attacked by the police. The police, however, refuted his claims. Police said the MLA inflicted injuries on himself. They said he did not obtain permission for replacing the statue. “They carried the idol from Rani Avanti Bai Lodh Bhavan at around 12.30am and reached Jumeraat Bazaar near the old statue at 2am. The new 25-ft statue was light weight and made of fibre. Fearing that it could cause damage to property, life and obstruct traffic in case it collapses, we suggested to the MLA not to install without a valid permission,” said ACP, west zone, AR Srinivas. Raja Singh initially came with around 50 people and soon the crowd swelled to around 400 by 2.30am. According to police, a scuffle broke out between the followers and cops. “Avanti Bai’s statue was installed at Jumeraat Bazaar in 2009 and was replaced twice in past 10 years. When we reached the area, cops led by two ACPs attacked us. When I tried to explain to the police that we replace the statue every five years, they did not pay heed to us and lathicharged my followers,” said Raja Singh. He alleged he was hit by four police officers — ACP of Goshamahal M Narender, ACP of Asif Nagar Narasimha Reddy and Shahinayathgunj SIs Gurumurthy and Ravi Kumar. However, a video of the incident doing the rounds on social media shows the MLA picking up a boulder and hitting himself on his head even as cops tried to stop him. The DCP said the Goshamahal MLA was making a false allegation on lathicharge. “It was the MLA who manhandled some of our cops and verbally abused the officers,” he said. Raja Singh was shifted to OGH for treatment. The MLA was booked under various sections of IPC. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rahul Gandhi.description: NEW DELHI: Strongly indicating that he does not intend to review his decision to step down as Congress president after the party's Lok Sabha debacle, Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said the party would decide on his successor and he would keep himself aloof from the process. Asked by the media in the Parliament complex about his possible successor, Rahul crucially did not parry the question but answered that he was not the person to decide on the issue and that it was a task for the party. After weeks of anonymous claims, this was the first confirmation of his intent to quit as the AICC chief ever since he announced the decision at a closed-door meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) on May 25. While the apex body turned down the resignation, Congress insiders said that Rahul is insistent on leaving the top job and had rebuffed all attempts to persuade him to stay on. Lok Sabha poll fallout: Congress considers naming interim presidentEven before Rahul publicly declared his intent, there were indications that Congress was considering naming a working president or interim president at the head of a "collegium" of leaders. Names of veterans like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sushilkumar Shinde, Ashok Gehlot, Mukul Wasnik and Prithviraj Chavan have done the rounds as likely candidates. Rahul's insistence that no one from the Gandhi family should hold the post effectively rules out sister Priyanka. Take charge, douse fire in Cong: Moily tells Rahul GandhiRahul's brief remark comes at a time when the party is caught in a bitter blame-game with its data department under Praveen Chakraborty in the crossfire for "misleading" the leadership on the trends in the Lok Sabha elections. The attack has been sharp with allegations that the data itself was not reliable with Chakraborty's proximity to Rahul raising the question whether the "feedback" only served to strengthen the leader's inclination to target PM Narendra Modi's image. Meanwhile, Rahul met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel along with AICC state in-charge P L Punia for a political discussion on Thursday evening. Party leaders attach importance to the meeting given that he has been reluctant to interact with colleagues lately. However, Rahul's public attestation about quitting may make it difficult for AICC managers to sway his thinking. As it became apparent that he might actually refuse to relent, various proposals have been mooted to make decision-making a collective affair through a "collegium" so that Rahul returns to active presidency. There have also been suggestions that a working president could be appointed. The proposal for a collegium is rooted in Rahul's complaint that he has been working alone and the party leaders did not pull their weight behind him in the LS polls. He had aired his grievances at the now-famous CWC brainstorming called after the party failed to improve its performance, going from 44 to 52. However, Congress leaders said they would continue to make efforts to persuade Rahul. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot told TOI, "Rahul has to remain the Congress president. He worked hard and fearlessly. Victory and defeat are part of polls." Gehlot warned if Rahul quits, Congress workers would either become inactive or leave the party.Sources say Rahul is hell-bent on quitting and has made it clear that none from the Gandhi family should be put at the helm of the Congress organisation. In Video:Won't decide who will be the next president of Congress: Rahul GandhiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Kaleshwaram, Bahubali of irrigation plan.description: HYDERABAD: Billed as ‘Bahubali’ of lift irrigation projects in the world and a brainchild of chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao, the gigantic Kaleshwaram Lift Irrigation Project will become a reality on Friday — three years and a month after the first (foundation) stone was laid on May 2, 2016, at Kannepally village in Mancherial district. A flagship scheme of the TRS government and considered to be the world’s biggest multi-stage lift irrigation project, Kaleshwaram, in many ways, is an engineering marvel in terms of massive underground pump houses, power pumps and underground tunnels. The mega project is meant to divert 195 tmcft of water from Godavari, covering a distance of 199km in the state, and utilise the water to irrigate 45 lakh acres — covering almost 70% of the state — in 13 districts, apart from providing drinking water to thousands of villages and industries. KCR has spared no efforts to make it a grand affair, inviting his counterparts in neighbouring Andhra Pradesh and Maharashtra — YS Jaganmohan Reddy and Devendra Fadnavis respectively — and governor ESL Narasimhan for the inauguration. The cost of the project is set to touch a staggering Rs 1 lakh crore from the initial Rs 80,196 crore — which is almost equal to the state budget four years ago. About half a dozen ministers are overseeing arrangements at various project sites such as Medigadda, Kannepally, Annaram, Sundilla, Nandi Medaram and other areas. Six helipads are being readied and the state government has engaged four choppers to bring Fadnavis, officials, governor and other officials, while Jagan will fly in his own chopper to the project site at Medigadda. One helipad is kept as a backup in case of emergency. “For the first time, bank officials belonging to the consortium of 20 banks which have financed the project have also been invited for the inauguration,” KCR said. The government took Rs 35,000 crore loan from various banks and irrigation officials will show the bankers where the amount has been spent. Health minister Eatala Rajender told TOI that the chief ministers will attend pujas at Medigadda, while a formal inauguration would be held at the Kannepally pump house. The uniqueness of the project is the biggest and crucial underground pumping station at Ramadugu (package 8) in Karimnagar district. Irrigation officials claim that each single electrical pump (Bahubali pumps) that was installed is so huge that it can fill the Hussainsagar lake in just a couple of days. If all the seven pumps with a capacity of 139 MW are switched together, they can discharge 21,000 cusecs, which is a rare feat in the irrigation sector. “Ramadugu pumping station can lift 3 tmcft a day. The pump house is located at a depth of 330 metres. Surge pool and additional surge pools of this pump house are the biggest in the world. For the first time, such constructions were taken up underground,” Megha Engineering and Infrastructure Ltd (MEIL) director B Srinivas Reddy told TOI. While MEIL executed the project, BHEL developed and supplied required pumps. Works at the Medigadda barrage itself created a record as 90,055 cubic metres of reinforced cement concrete was laid in a single day by L&T on the spillway and piers last year. Telangana CM Chandrasekhar Rao on several occasions said generally any irrigation project takes several decades to complete the works, but Kaleshwaram project is being completed (phase I) in a record time of three years and giving water to the farmers. Hyderabad: Woman\u2019s bid to escape hu.description: HYDERABAD: A migrant labourer, who rushed to the second floor of a building in Old Mallapur to escape her husband’s body blows, slipped and fell from there along with her baby girl. While 21-year-old Damini Kuldeep survived with severe injuries, her one-and-a-half-year-old daughter Vidya died on the spot. The tragedy took place at 11pm on Tuesday. “Damini stood on the edge of the under-construction building and pleaded with her husband Yogesh to stop harassing her and threatened to jump. She kept the baby girl on the edge and asked Yogesh to take care of her daughter. Suddenly, she slipped and fell from the terrace of the building. The infant also fell down accidentally,” said Nacharam inspector M Mahesh. Damini suffered fractures on her left hand and leg, while Vidya died of internal injuries. Both were shifted to Gandhi Hospital. Police said the couple is from Chhattisgarh and were involved in a heated argument. “Yogesh suspected Damini’s character and went on to accuse her of developing an illegal relationship with another man. In a fit of rage, he started beating her up,” said a police officer. Damini picked up the baby girl and rushed to the terrace to escape his wrath. However, Yogesh followed her to the terrace. The migrant labourer-couple had shifted to Hyderabad six months ago and were staying in the under construction building where 12 other migrant workers also stayed. A case has been registered under Sections 498-A (husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty), 304(II) (culpable homicide not amounting to murder) and 307 (attempt to murder) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC). Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\u2018This Telugu detective will go on t.description: After cracking the audience up with numerous viral videos as the ‘honest groom’ in Honest Indian Weddings, the ‘frustrated techie’ in Frustrated IT Employee or the engineering student who’s irked with the world’s English obsession in The Truth of Engineering, Naveen Polishetty is all set to make his debut as a Tollywood ‘hero’, with Agent Sai Srinivasa Athreya. The actor plays a detective who believes he’s more famous than he actually is. Confident that this character has what it takes to become iconic, Naveen says, “This is an once-in-a-lifetime debut. Honestly, how often does one get to play a character like this?” Apparently, director Swaroop RSJ’s narration was so intriguing that he was hooked from the word go. “When he told the name of the film, I even joked that we would have to release two posters just to fit the whole name in. But, the fact that the protagonist was a detective made me curious. When I was told that he runs a detective agency called FBI from a vegetable market in Nellore, it just cinched it for me.” Prepping for the part was really difficult though, says Naveen. “I was part of Swaroop’s writing team for a year just so I could understand the character better. By the end of it, I got a hang of how he would react to everything. For the past two years, the line between the real me and the character I play has been blurring. I have become more observant, noticing little details I didn’t before, much like a detective would,” says Naveen, who admits that making his debut as a lead actor is a dream come true. “Acting has been a childhood dream. In fact, viral videos happened accidentally when I was in Mumbai auditioning for movie roles. But they did open new doors for me. I went from being an aspiring actor to someone everyone knew thanks to my videos,” says the actor, who is excited to see how the audience receives the film. Produced by Rahul Yadav Nakka under Swadharm Entertainment, Agent Sai Srinivasa Athreya releases today.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Can\u2019t order relief in Inter suicide.description: HYDERABAD: Stating that only a minuscule 0.16 percentage of failed intermediate students were declared as passed after reverification, and that the Inter board cannot be held responsible for such minor discrepancies, the Telangana high court on Wednesday refused to direct the state to grant compensation to the students who committed suicide immediately after the result were declared in April this year. The bench of Acting Chief Justice Raghavendra Singh Chauhan and Justice Shameem Akther said this while disposing of a petition filed by P Atchuta Rao of Balala Hakkula Sangham and advocate Rapolu Bhaskar, who sought stringent action against board officials responsible for this. The bench said that a total of 3.82 lakh students had failed, and the reverification resulted in a mere 1,183 students securing pass marks and this cannot be described as a huge discrepancy. The bench, however, described the suicides as unfortunate, and left the issue of punishing the errant officials to the state and the board. A departmental probe can be launched against the negligent staff and officials, it said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Former irrigation minister Harish Rao ge.description: HYDERABAD: On the eve of the inauguration of Kaleshwaram project, former irrigation minister T Harish Rao on Thursday released an emotional statement saying the project was a big step in the direction of realisation of the dream that was the core of the separate Telangana movement. “This is a result of the struggle of the people and the sacrifices made by martyrs for Telangana statehood,” he said. The Siddipet MLA said the credit for the project should go to chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao. Harish Rao said when an irrigation project was deliberately designed by the previous governments, so that it could get caught in wrangles between various states, it was KCR who redesigned it. Describing KCR as ‘Aparabhageerathudu’, he said he had approached Maharashtra and settled the water issue amicable so that the Kaleshwaram project could be constructed. “I would like to thank KCR for supervising the construction of the project and getting it done in a record time,” he said. Harish Rao said project engineers, employees and workers had worked through all seasons and in difficult weather conditions and congratulated them for their work. “I salute the farmers of Telangana who are overwhelmed on the inauguration of the project. I pray to God that the dream of a green Telangana should be realised,” he said. Harish Rao ended his statement with ‘Jai Telangana..Jai Kisan’. Nowhere in the statement did he mention that he was the irrigation minister in the previous government under chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao and worked on the execution of the project. It may be mentioned here that in KCR’s second time after the assembly elections in December 2018, Harish Rao was not inducted into the cabinet. KCR himself kept the irrigation portfolio. The project will be inaugurated on Friday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maoist couple\u2019sflat searched.description: Hyderabad: Almost 10 days after a Maoist couple was arrested by Maharashtra police, Krishna Kumari and Kiran Kumar were brought to their Alwal residence here on Wednesday. Extensive searches were conducted in the house in the presence of the couple whose exitence cops were not aware of till they were apprehended in Maharashtra. The couple, who have been working in the Dandakaranya special zonal committee, were nabbed by Maharashtra police in coordination with Special Intelligence Bureau of Telangana. The couple hail from Krishna district in Andhra Pradesh and took a flat in Alwal. They used to visit the flat occasionally. The aged couple were undergoing treatment in a private hospital in the city, police said. TNN Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tough times ahead for TDP as BJP goes fo.description: AMARAVATI: The decision of four Rajya Sabha MPs to join the BJP has made the political road ahead an arduous one for the TDP. Former Union minister YS Chowdary, CM Ramesh, TG Venkatesh and Garikapati Mohan Rao announced TDP’s merger with the BJP in the Rajya Sabha. Now many MLAs and former MLAs may follow suit. TDP has 23 MLAs and it might be difficult for party president N Chandrababu Naidu to keep the flock together. TDP survived a similar crisis when the Congress was in power in the state during 2004-2014. Naidu could revive TDP’s fortunes thanks to the hurried bifurcation of the state that decimated the Congress. The comparison between Jagan and Naidu in 2014 helped the veteran Naidu clinch victory over the young leader as people thought his experience in the administration would help heal bifurcation injuries. Analysts say BJP is keen to eliminate TDP in the state in order to occupy the political space. Naidu’s troubles began when he quit the NDA. His aggressive campaign against Prime Minister Narendra Modi made him BJP’s enemy No.1. There was speculation about Sujana Chowdary joining BJP for long, but it came too early for Naidu. TG Venkatesh said he had informed Naidu last week. “Naidu asked me not to take any hasty decision, but I made up my mind in the interest of the state,” said Venkatesh. The split in TDP is expected to encourage more defections from the party. Sources said BJP has accepted to take the defectors on board as it has no majority in the Upper House to clear crucial constitutional amendment bills. TDP has six members in Rajya Sabha. Its strength is now reduced to two in the Upper House. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Civic staff\u2019 cull 30 dogs in.description: -By Srirupa Goswami HYDERABAD: Some 30 dogs were culled by municipal workers in Vikarabad (70km from Hyderabad) on Wednesday morning. When locals tried to stop them, the workers claimed they had been given orders by the municipal commissioner. According to a resident, Chaitanya K, municipal workers used long sticks with poisonous needles to cull the dogs. “These dogs did not harm anyone. My father and I used to feed them. When I confronted the workers who were killing these dogs, I was asked to mind my own business, as the culling was ordered by the municipal commissioner,” said Chaitanya. Later, the bodies were buried in a municipal dump yard using an earth mover. When TOI contacted Vikarabad municipal commissioner, P Bhogishwar, he denied giving such orders. “I did not order the culling of dogs. People have been coming up to me asking me to take some action against the growing dog population in the area. But I did not order any staff to go on a killing spree,” he said. When asked about how the staff could go on culling dogs without his order, he said that none of the staff was involved in the culling and it was done by an outsider. An FIR has been registered under Section 11 of Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, 1960 and Section 429 (killing animals by mischief) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC). Further inquiry will be carried out by Vikarabad superintendent G Lakshmaiah. The local complainant has requested to conduct a post-mortem in order to ascertain the kind of poison injected to kill these dogs, and also to investigate as to how the source of such poison was available so casually and readily. This was second time dog culling was carried out in Vikarabad after September 9, 2017. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

H1B Visa news.description: WASHINGTON: The Trump administration has no plans to cap H-1B work visas for nations that force foreign companies to store data locally, the state department said on Thursday. Reuters reported on Wednesday that the United States had told India it was considering restricting the H-1B visa programmes for countries with the data storage requirement. The H-1B programme issues US visas to skilled foreign workers. US mulling 15% cap on H-1B visa for Indians"The Trump Administration has no plans to place caps on H-1B work visas for nations that force foreign companies to store data locally," a state department spokeswoman said in a statement in response to the Reuters article. While an administration's "Buy American Hire American" executive order calls for a broad review of US worker visa programs, including the H-1B programme, it was not targeted at a specific country, the spokeswoman said. It is "completely separate from our ongoing discussions with India about the importance of ensuring the free flow of data across borders," the spokeswoman added. Earlier on Thursday, India said it was in talks with the United States on H-1B visas, but foreign ministry spokesman Raveesh Kumar told a news conference: "We have not heard anything officially from the US government" on capping such permits for Indians. US secretary of state Mike Pompeo is scheduled to visit New Delhi next week for talks that will include areas of disagreement between the two countries over trade. H-1B cap for India? It’s not easy and may need approval by US Congress, say expertsTwo senior Indian officials told Reuters on Wednesday they had been briefed last week on a US plan to cap the number of H-1B visas given annually to Indians at between 10% and 15% of the total number issued. There is no country-specific limit on the 85,000 H-1B work visas the United States issues every year, and an estimated 70% of them go to Indians. In Video:No communication on H-1B visa cap from US: Commerce ministryDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Business News.

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Lorry runs over 20-year-old engineering.description: HYDERABAD: A 20-year-old BTech student riding pillion on a bike was run over by a lorry at Shadnagar on Wednesday. Irate family members of the victim vandalised the lorry and staged a dharna demanding stringent punishment for the accused driver, who fled from the spot. The victim Shagufta Simran is daughter of a head constable in excise department. Simran was going towards her Paradise Colony residence with her neighbour when accident happened. “Simran fell from the vehicle and was crushed under the tyres of the lorry. She died on the spot,” said Shadnagar SI Vijan Bhaskar. The duo was not wearing helmets. A case under Section 304-A (causing death by negligence) of IPC was filed. Irrum Manzil, Hyderabad\u2019s iconic ad.description: HYDERABAD: The 150-year-old Irrum Manzil is likely to be demolished to make way for the proposed Telangana State Assembly complex. If that happens, this would be the second heritage building in the city to be razed. Earlier, the state government had demolished the century-old IAS Officers Club, a heritage structure. The official residence-cum-camp office of the chief minister was constructed at the site. Irrum Manzil is spread over 2.2 lakh square feet. It is an iconic heritage property built in 1870 by Nawab Safdar Jung Musheer-ud-Dowla Fakhrul Mulk. The building’s architecture reflects Indo-European Baroque style. The building is now in a dilapidated condition for want of regular repairs or maintenance. Till 1956, the Public Works Department (PWD) used to operate from the building. Later, the premises was allotted to the Roads and Buildings (R&B) department. After a new building was constructed for the R&B department, the palace remained largely unused. Post bifurcation of the state in 2014, three of the rooms of the palace were allotted to R&B, Andhra Pradesh. “The palace is a heritage property. The entire building needs to be razed to make way for the proposed assembly complex. The palace is in a bad shape due to lack of maintenance,” a senior official of the R&B department told TOI. Along with the palace, the six-storey building housing the office of the Irrigation and Command Area Development (I&CAD) and Irrigation- affiliated wings, is likely to be pulled down. The building was constructed in 2000. It was named Jala Soudha and has a built-up area of about 2.2 lakh sq feet. About 2,000 employees work in the Jala Soudha. So, the I&CAD department needs to find a new premises. Officials, however, said the greenery spread over 1.5 acres will be protected. The entire palace premises was handed over to R&B department, Telangana, on Wednesday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Telangana State Council of Higher Educat.description: HYDERABAD: Courses, credits and grades in degree colleges across Telangana will be common from the academic year 2019-20 as the Telangana State Council of Higher Education (TSCHE) has decided to standardize implementation of choice based credit system (CBCS) in all state universities. Until last year, implementation of CBCS varied in every state university. However, to simplify the existing process, the TSCHE along with representatives from state universities, decided to bring in uniformity at all levels. “Earlier, undergraduate commerce course was of 180 credits vis-à-vis engineering course of 160 credits. Similarly, distribution of credits for core courses also varied in state universities,” said Prof R Limbadri, convenor of degree online services Telangana and vice-chairman 1 of TSCHE. “To reduce burden on degree students, we decided to implement 150 credits for all degree courses across all state universities,” he said. In series of meetings held in the last 10 days, the TSCHE also decided to make changes in the grading system. Officials were of the view that lack of uniformity in the grading system was causing inconvenience among students who pursue competitive exams such as SET, NET or post-graduate entrance tests. “In few universities, A grade is awarded to those who secure 90-100 marks. Whereas, in few others, A grade is awarded to those who secure 80-100 marks. Since there is lack of uniformity in grading system, Telangana students who go ahead to pursue competitive exams face issues,” said Limbadri. The TSCHE has decided to enhance employability of students by focusing more on ability enhancement and skill enhancement courses. “Considering the change in industry requirements, universities will be offering ability enhancement and skill enhancement courses to improve communication skills, computer knowledge and understand of environment of students,” said Altaf Hussain, vice-chancellor of Mahatma Gandhi University, Nalgonda. “Based on the course, all the universities will offer choice of six to eight electives per semester for skill enhancement and ability enhancement. Of these, students have to select one elective per semester,” said Hussain. The state universities have also decided to earmark 80 per cent for core courses and 20 per cent for massive online open courses. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Telangana govt stakes claim on Rs 50-cr.description: HYDERABAD: One acre of land in Hi-tec City area, the market value of which is around Rs 50 crore, has become a serious bone of contention with the government claiming that the land parcel belongs to it even as a film producer staked claim on the said land. Amid these claims and counter-claims, a nationalised bank is planning to auction the disputed land to recover Rs 11 crore loan from the producer after he defaulted on its payment. Alerted by this, the revenue department is now trying to stop the auction and recover the land parcel. The revenue department realised that the land was pledged with UCO Bank after producer Burugupalli Sivaramakrishna failed to clear Rs 11 crore to the bank, which initiated the process to auction the land to recover its loan amount. Officials of the asset management branch of UCO Bank at Somajiguda recalled that Sivaramakrishna, proprietor of Sree Venkateswara Art Films, took a loan from the bank by pledging one acre of a total 10 acres in survey number 80/A in Hafeezpet village of Serilingampally mandal. The producer’s outstanding amount to the bank now stands at Rs 11.19 crore. “The entire land spread over 485 acres, is in dispute with individuals, firms and the government fighting over it for the last few decades,” K Chandrakala, revenue divisional officer of Rajendranagar, Rangareddy, told TOI. The RDO argued that the said land cannot be pledged with banks. “We came to know about this through a bank notice in a newspaper. We will approach the government pleader to stop the auction of the land,” she added. When contacted, Rangareddy district joint collector S Harish told TOI that he had asked the revenue officials concerned to check the land records. UCO Bank officials, however, said the loan was granted in 2010 after its legal wing perused the documents submitted by the producer. “The government should have stopped registration of the land if it had any doubt. We will go ahead with the auction of the land next month,” a senior manager of UCO Bank asset management branch told TOI. Sivaramarkrishna, on his part, said he had taken NOC, building permission order, etc., from GHMC for constructing villas in 17 acres. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nizam\u2019s necklace sold for Rs 17cr a.description: HYDERABAD: The 400 pieces of Indian jewellery that were put under the hammer at Christie’s in New York on June 19, fetched about $109 million (Rs 758 crore approximately), including several from the treasure house of Nizam Mir Osman Ali Khan. One of the pieces from Hyderabad, a ceremonial sword of the Nizam, fetched Rs 13.4 crore, while the Mirror of Paradise diamond (52.58 carats), which originated from Golconda mines, went for $6,517,500 (nearly Rs 45 crore). An antique diamond riviere necklace from treasure house of the Nizams was auctioned for $2,415,000 (nearly Rs 17 crore). Some of the bidders said that the 33-diamond necklace surpassed its estimate. The necklace was estimated to be sold for $1,500,000 (nearly Rs 10.5 crore), Christie’s announced on Twitter. Meanwhile, in Hyderabad, the Nizam’s family was glued online to find out the exact price for which the jewels were sold. Mir Najaf Ali Khan, grandson of late Nizam Mir Osman Ali Khan, said he almost cried when the white pearl necklace was sold. During the auction, a 17-carat Golconda “Arcot II” diamond, once owned by the Nawab of Arcot, went for $3,375,00 (Rs 23.5 crore). The auction started with the ‘Indore Sapphire Taveez Bead Pendant Necklace.A statement from the Christie’s said it was the highest total for any auction of Indian art and Mughal objects, and the second-highest auction total for a private jewellery collection. The auction continued for over 12 hours and had bidders from India and 44 other countries. Royal families of Jaipur, Indore and Baroda were also represented in the sale. The auction started with the ‘Indore Sapphire Taveez Bead Pendant Necklace, Mounted by Cartier for Indore’s Maharaja Yeshwant Rao Holkar II. He was educated in England and was known for gifting expensive jewels to his wife. The royal necklace fetched $60,000 (Rs 42 lakh), the auctioneers said. The collection of jewellery was owned by the cousin of the ruler of Qatar, Sheikh Hamad bin Abdullah Al Thani. “We witnessed a record total for the world’s greatest collection of Indian jewels and jewelled objects to ever be brought to auction,” Rahul Kadakia, International Head of Jewellery at Christie’s, said in a statement. The collection of jewellery was owned by the cousin of the ruler of Qatar, Sheikh Hamad bin Abdullah Al Thani. Sheikh Al Thani is relatively a new entrant into the jewellery collection and sale business. He began buying precious pieces somewhere in 2009. Today he is said to own about 6,000 pieces of jewellery from across the world. The seventh and the last Nizam’s successor Mir Barkat Ali Khan alias Nawab Mukarram Jah is unwell and lives in Turkey. His younger brother Mir Karamat Ali Khan alias Nawab Muffakham Jah has chosen to live in London. It is not known what were their reactions over the sale of jewellery. AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders.
